intro: Indigofera heterophylla, commonly known as the variable indigo bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, variable leaf shapes. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple, often appearing in clusters. It is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, growing in sandy or rocky soils. Indigofera heterophylla is adapted to withstand drought and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
